title: The Water Knife
author: Paolo Bacigalupi
overview: In a future where water is scarce and controlled by corrupt figures, three individuals fight for their own survival and for others.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
overview: A father and son traverse a landscape blasted by an unspecified cataclysm that has destroyed most of civilization.

title: Parable of the Sower
author: Octavia E. Butler
overview: In a future where society has collapsed due to climate change and wealth inequality, a young woman creates her own religion in hopes of saving humanity.

title: The Year of the Flood
author: Margaret Atwood
overview: Set in a future world devastated by a man-made plague, this novel tells the story of a religious sect, the God's Gardeners, who predicted the disaster and are now trying to recover.

author: George Orwell
overview: A social critique of totalitarianism and authoritarianism implemented by government bureaucracy in the historic year of 1984.

title: Foundation
author: Isaac Asimov
overview: A mathematician who has developed a concept of psychohistory, uses it to foresee the future and the eventual fall of the Galactic Empire.
tags: Galactic Empire, a future science fiction empire.

title: I, Robot
author: Isaac Asimov
overview: A collection of nine short stories sharing common theme of interaction between humans and robots and the ethical implications of it.

title: The Help
author: Kathryn Stockett
overview: Set in 1960s Mississippi, this novel follows the lives of black maids working in white households and their experiences of racial discrimination and prejudice. A young white woman, Skeeter, decides to write a book about their stories, risking her reputation and friendships.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
overview: Set in Afghanistan, this novel tells the story of Amir, a young boy from Kabul, and his journey of redemption. It explores themes of friendship, guilt, and the impact of war on individuals and society.

title: Water for Elephants
author: Sara Gruen
overview: This novel follows the story of Jacob Jankowski, a young man who joins a traveling circus during the Great Depression. It explores the complex relationships between circus performers, including a forbidden love affair and the challenges of surviving in a harsh era.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
overview: Set in Nazi Germany during World War II, this novel narrated by Death follows the story of Liesel Meminger, a young girl who finds solace in stealing books and sharing them with others. It explores the power of words and the resilience of the human spirit.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
overview: This psychological thriller follows journalist Mikael Blomkvist and hacker Lisbeth Salander as they investigate a decades-old disappearance of a wealthy industrialist's niece. It delves into themes of corruption, violence, and the dark secrets of the Swedish elites.

title: And Then There Were None
author: Agatha Christie
overview: Ten strangers are invited to a secluded island, and one by one, they are murdered. As the tension rises and suspicion grows, they must figure out who among them is the killer before it's too late.

title: Angels & Demons
author: Dan Brown
overview: This thrilling novel follows symbologist Robert Langdon as he unravels a mystery involving a secret society, the Illuminati, and a plot to destroy Vatican City. It combines elements of history, art, and science in a race against time to save the Catholic Church.

title: Rebecca
author: Daphne du Maurier
overview: A young woman marries a wealthy widower, only to find herself haunted by the memory of his deceased wife, Rebecca. She becomes obsessed with uncovering the truth about Rebecca's death and faces dark secrets and unexpected twists along the way.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
overview: Set in the 1930s in a small Southern town, this novel tells the story of Scout Finch, a young girl growing up amidst racial inequality and injustice. Through the eyes of Scout, the reader witnesses the trial of a black man accused of rape and the moral lessons learned by her father, Atticus Finch.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
overview: Set in the Roaring Twenties, this novel follows the life of Jay Gatsby and his pursuit of the American Dream. Through the eyes of narrator Nick Carraway, the reader is immersed in the opulence, social decadence, and unfulfilled desires of the wealthy elite.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
overview: The first installment of the beloved Harry Potter series introduces the magical world of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. It follows the journey of Harry Potter, an orphan who discovers his true identity as a wizard and his battle against the dark wizard Lord Voldemort.
